title: Coronavirus Campus News & Updates
description: This page is for historical purposes only. All current Campus Coronavirus information can be found at https://campusreturn.ucr.edu/ Latest updates from campus on COVID-19 Additional information can also be found at Campus Return.
cleaned_text: This page is for historical purposes only. All current Campus Coronavirus information can be found at [https://campusreturn.ucr.edu/](https://campusreturn.ucr.edu/) Latest updates from campus on COVID-19 Additional information can also be found at [Campus Return. ](https://campusreturn.ucr.edu/) August 23, 2021: [Student COVID-19 vaccine noncompliance update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/08/23/student-covid-19-vaccine-noncompliance-update) Information on Student COVID-19 vaccine noncompliance. August 18, 2021: [Let's Do R Part campaign](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/08/18/lets-do-r-part-campaign) UC Riverside students and employees are encouraged to help ensure a safe and successful return to campus through the Let's Do R Part campaign. August 13, 2021: [Student vaccine submission deadline](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/08/13/student-vaccine-submission-deadline) Fall quarter is quickly approaching. In an effort to return to campus safely, we have been encouraging our students, staff, and faculty to get vaccinated and submit their proof of vaccination sooner than later. Well, later has come, and the deadline to submit your vaccination information is Monday, August 16, 2021 by 11:59 p.m. August 11, 2021: [Vaccine submission deadline](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/08/11/vaccine-submission-deadline) Thank you to each of you who has submitted your COVID-19 vaccination record. As of this week, we have received vaccination records for over 67% of employees. August 3, 2021: Updated [Non-UCR Affiliate, Visitors and Vendors Guidance](/document/covid-19-non-ucr-affiliate-guide) August 3, 2021: [Updated daily wellness check](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/08/03/updated-daily-wellness-check) Please bookmark wellnesscheck.ucr.edu and make sure you complete the survey before coming to work. July 28, 2021: [Face coverings while indoors](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/07/28/face-coverings-while-indoors) Effective July 29, 2021, mask wearing will be required indoors while on campus owned or operated facilities (including vehicles), regardless of vaccination status. July 28, 2021: [Campus buildings opening date ](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/07/28/campus-buildings-opening-date) Beginning Monday, August 16, 2021, UCR campus building locations will return to normal pre-pandemic unlocking and locking schedules. July 26, 2021: [Chancellor's Update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/07/26/chancellors-update-july-2021)- July 2021 Chancellor's campus update, featuring information on the state budget, coffee socials, daily wellness check and face coverings, vaccine requirement, Chancellor's Distinguished Lecture series, and more. July 21, 2021: [UC SARS CoV-2 (COVID-19) Vaccination Program Policy](https://policy.ucop.edu/doc/5000695/SARS-Cov-2) The SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) Vaccination Program Policy has been updated to include Implementation Guidance. July 19, 2021: [UCR campus operations update](/document/campus-operations-update-0719-2021) Updates on how to best prepare for a safe return, including parking, building security and access, drinking fountains/hydrations stations, HVAC/ventilation, Building air filters, cleaning and disinfecting schedule, and more. July 16, 2021: [Vaccination requirement, submit your student vaccination record by August 16](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/07/16/vaccination-requirement-submit-your-student-vaccination-record-august-16) A new UC vaccination policy has gone into effect. All UC Riverside employees and students must upload a vaccination record by Monday, August 16 July 16, 2021: [New vaccination policy, submit your employee vaccination record by August 16](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/07/16/new-vaccination-policy-submit-your-employee-vaccination-record-august-16) A new UC vaccination policy has gone into effect. All UC Riverside employees and students must upload a vaccination record by Monday, August 16 July 14, 2021: [UCR campus operations update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/07/14/ucr-campus-operations-update) Updates on how to best prepare for a safe return, including parking, building security and access, drinking fountains/hydrations stations, HVAC/ventilation, Building air filters, cleaning and disinfecting schedule, and more. July 13, 2021: [What's open on campus now](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/stories/2021/07/13/whats-open-campus-now) Find out what services are available and what to expect as the campus gradually reopens. July 13, 2021: [Use of Federal Higher Education Emergency Relief Funds (HEERF) at UCR](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/07/13/use-federal-higher-education-emergency-relief-funds-heerf-ucr?utm_source=Inside+UCR+Weekly+Test&utm_campaign=0e73b28ba9-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2021_07_13_06_23&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_e039f36024-0e73b28ba9-92866107) Congress has passed three rounds of stimulus acts, each of which offered financial relief to institutions of higher education. July 1, 2021: [Policy Rescission - Travel Risk Reduction](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/07/01/policy-rescission-travel-risk-reduction) The interim policy on Travel Risk Reduction (900-25) has been rescinded. This was an interim policy that outlined the requirements for travel to ensure the health, safety, and security of the UCR community, including while traveling. In line with the Chancellor's [June 23, 2021 communication](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/06/23/campus-and-workplace-covid-update) and UC Office of the President's [March 12, 2021 updated travel guidelines](https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/news/2021/03/updated-travel-guidelines-for-the-uc-community.html), exceptional approval for travel is no longer required. June 30, 2021: [Research Ramp-up update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/06/30/research-ramp-updates) Labs and research facilities are now allowed to function at 100% capacity, provided new [Worksite Specific Plans](https://ehs.ucr.edu/coronavirus/worksite_specific_plan) (WSSPs) are submitted and approved, or WSSPs are updated to include additional lab personnel or additional research activities. June 23, ,2021: [Campus and Workplace COVID Update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/06/23/campus-and-workplace-covid-update) Chancellor's message on the latest guidance on workplace requirements for workplace safety from Cal/OSHA. June 21, 2021: [Campus Operations Update](/document/campus-operations-update) Update on Campus Operations: parking, building security and access, drinking fountains/hydration stations, HVAC/ventilation, building air filters, and more. June 15, 2021: [How California's June 15 reopening will affect UCR](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/stories/2021/06/15/how-californias-june-15-reopening-will-affect-ucr) The California economy will reopen June 15 with the state lifting many restrictions on restaurants, stores, and other businesses. But at UC Riverside, like many state colleges and universities, the process will be a gradual one with no immediate changes expected. June 11, 2021: [Time to vaccinate](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/06/11/time-vaccinate) Chancellor Wilcox urges the campus to get vaccinated, shares the UC Vaccination Policy, how to submit your vaccination record and incentives May 27, 2021: [UCR guidelines for events/gatherings](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/05/27/ucr-guidelines-eventsgatherings) The UC Riverside Operational Continuity Working Group has issued campus events and gatherings guidelines, including a gatherings checklist and approval process. May 26, 2021: [Chancellor Update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/05/26/chancellors-update-may-2021) Chancellor Wilcox provides campus update on Fall Planning, Commencement, remembering George Floyd, Staff Assembly, and more. May 26, 2021: [Campus Return Updates](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/05/26/campus-return-updates-may-26) Updates from Research Ramp-up, COVID Management, sand Operational Continuity. View the [webinars on You Tube](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLIBpM9gjaPckxGtdxU1BzGzWOQY8n351x). May 20, 2021: Return to Campus Working Group Webinars View the Return to Campus Working Group [webinars on You Tube](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLIBpM9gjaPckxGtdxU1BzGzWOQY8n351x) May 19, 2021: [Campus Return Updates](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/05/19/campus-return-updates-may-19) Updates from the five campus working groups to plan for the fall and the transition to returning to campus. May 19, 2021: [Student Instruction for COVID-19vaccination proof of completion](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/05/18/student-instructions-covid-19-vaccination-proof-completion) The university is encouraging students to get a vaccination prior to our return to campus in fall. Vaccinations can be obtained through local pharmacies, including CVS and Walgreens, county clinics, in addition to your primary healthcare provider. May 19, 2021: [Vaccine Tracking Form](https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__ucriverside.az1.qualtrics.com_jfe_form_SV-5Fd4heACqMVngXcua&d=DwMFAg&c=LsLxleeqPm1pgCNn-PN_bQ&r=DVuYMim0MHu9at-6K7xIOpqzsFuCI_3qmhydLMERKt8&m=Me1SYRudQWbdQHjl2Vgb-o1heDxVxCYROWEkJZqKhcs&s=etd0LR42V53MvgloE4jU0RExdZGEQINo8d4BrPbnnqI&e=) The COVID-19 Vaccine Tracking form is intended to collect the COVID-19 immunization records for UCR faculty, staff, student workers, and volunteers as part of a process to safely return to campus. All health information [voluntarily] provided by you in the form will remain confidential. May 19, 2021: [Campus Planning Framework](/document/covid-planning-framework) You can view the current campus planning framework, updated 05/19/2021. May 18, 2021: [Campus sees drop in COVID-19 cases while vaccination rates rise](https://news.ucr.edu/articles/2021/05/18/campus-sees-drop-covid-19-cases-while-vaccination-rates-rise?utm_source=UC+Riverside+Master+List&utm_campaign=a4876195a5-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2021_05_19_11_08&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_6a473f0f9b-a4876195a5-93368348) Since mid-April, UC Riverside has had only a handful of positive COVID-19 cases, continuing a rapid decline that began in January. May 12, 2021: [COVID-19 Vaccine Tracking Form](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/05/13/covid-19-vaccine-tracking-form) The UC Office of the President recently shared the details of a proposed policy on COVID-19 vaccination for employees and students at all University of California campuses. While the policy has not yet taken effect, we are preparing for the likelihood of the policy's adoption. May 12, 2021: [Campus return updates for May 12](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/05/12/campus-return-updates-may-12) UC Riverside has created five campus working groups to plan for the fall and the transition to returning to campus. May 10, 2021: [Campus buildings access remains limited](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/05/10/campus-buildings-access-remains-limited) Although UC Riverside is planning for a safe return to campus this fall, access to campus buildings and other facilities remains limited for now and should be arranged in advance. May 4, 2021: FAQ's available for UC Proposed Vaccination Policy Frequently asked questions regarding the University of California Proposed Vaccine Policy is now available for [Faculty and Staff](/document/employee-faqs-uc-proposed-vaccination-policy) as well as [Students](/document/student-faqs-uc-vaccination-policy). April 29, 2021: [Chancellor's Update - April 2021](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/29/chancellors-update-april-2021) Chancellor Wilcox shares an update to the campus on recent events, including Violence against Asian/Americans and Pacific Islander community, the Chancellors Committee on the Status on Women, the Accellion data breach, leadership office hours and Sustainability. April 27, 2021: [FAQ on UC's proposed COVID-19 vaccination policy](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/stories/2021/04/27/faq-ucs-proposed-covid-19-vaccination-policy) The University of California last week shared the details of a proposed policy on COVID-19 vaccination as part of its engagement with its community as it joins the California State University in supporting immunizations as part of an expected return of students, faculty, academic appointees and staff to in-person instruction across the state this fall. April 27, 2021: [Return to campus working group briefings begin this week](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/stories/2021/04/27/return-campus-working-group-briefings-begin-week) Each of the Return to Campus working groups will deliver a briefing for the campus community about their planning efforts for the fall. April 22, 2021: [UC encourages COVID-19 vaccinations for university communities while reviewing policy requirements](https://www.universityofcalifornia.edu/press-room/uc-encourages-covid-19-vaccinations-university-communities-while-reviewing-policy) The University of California today (April 22) shared the details of a proposed policy on COVID-19 vaccination as part of its engagement with its community as it joins the California State University in supporting immunizations as part of an expected return of students, faculty, academic appointees and staff to in-person instruction across the state this fall. April 21: 2021: [Campus Return Update 4/21](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/21/campus-return-updates-april-21) Each of the Return to Campus working groups will deliver a briefing for the campus community, which will be available for viewing on the UC Riverside [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/user/ucriverside). April 15, 2021: [Chancellor Wilcox talks about returning to campus](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MweYnNtsuC4) A video message from the Chancellor about returning to campus this fall. April 14, 2021: [Campus return updated for April 14](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/14/campus-return-updates-april-14) UC Riverside has created five campus working groups to plan for the fall and the transition to returning to campus. Read the latest updates from the working groups. April 13, 2021: [Labs may increase density up to 50% maximum occupancy](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/13/labs-may-increase-density-50-maximum-occupancy) Effective immediately, the UCR Research Ramp-up Committee has approved all laboratories on campus with an updated [Work Site Specific Plan (WSSP)](https://ehs.ucr.edu/coronavirus/worksite_specific_plan) to increase their personnel density up to 50% of maximum occupancy. The decision applies to all labs, including dry/computational labs which may have been closed up to this point, and all lab personnel — faculty, staff, postdoctoral researchers, and graduate/undergraduate students. [Learn more](https://campusreturn.ucr.edu/research-ramp) about Research Ramp Up Committee. April 9, 2021: [Commencement Follow-up for Graduating Students](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/09/commencement-follow-graduating-students) Clarification on a few key points regarding commencement. April 8, 2021: [California Assembly Bill 685 - Request for Anonymity on COVID-19 Notifications to Unions](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/08/california-assembly-bill-685-request-anonymity-covid-19-notifications) This communication is to inform you of required union notifications related to positive cases of COVID-19. April 7, 2021: [Campus return updates for April 7](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/07/campus-return-updates-april-7) UC Riverside has created five campus working groups to plan for the fall and the transition to returning to campus. April 7, 2021: [In-person Commencement activities, classes of 2020 and 2021](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/07/person-commencement-activities-classes-2020-and-2021) Recommendations from the Commencement Task Force for limited, in-person commencement activities for the graduating classes of 2021 and 2020. April 6: 2021: [UC COVID-19 related leaves](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/04/06/uc-covid-19-related-leaves) Recent guidance on University of California's (UC) COVID-19 Related Leaves for policy-covered and represented staff employees. March 31, 2021: [Campus return updates for March 31](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/31/campus-return-updates-march-31) UC Riverside has created five campus working groups to plan for the fall and the transition to returning to campus. March 29, 2021: [Undergraduate researchers back to campus](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/29/undergraduate-researchers-back-campus) The Research Ramp-up Committee has carefully evaluated the situation and has approved the return of undergraduates under the following conditions and process. March 29, 2021: [Student Recreation Center to open March 29 at limited capacity](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/29/student-recreation-center-open-march-29-limited-capacity) Opening of the Student Recreation Center (SRC) beginning Monday, March 29 at limited capacity. March 25, 2021: [Resource Management Services are now available on a limited capacity](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/25/resource-management-services-are-now-available-limited-capacity) Facilities Services is happy to announce the return of our Resource Management staff March 24, 2021: [Personnel/Human Resources Practices Update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/24/personnelhuman-resources-practices-update-0) Update on Personnel and Human Resource interim practices effective April 1, 2021 March 17, 2021: [Clarification on COVID-19 paid time off](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/17/clarification-covid-19-paid-time) UCOP issued further clarification on paid time off. March 12, 2021: [New Pandemic Relief for Flexible Spending Arrangement (FSA) Participants](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/12/new-pandemic-relief-flexible-spending-arrangement-fsa-participants) Update on Flexible Spending Arrangements (FSA) for participants. March 4, 2021: COVID-19 Guidance Resources View and download guidance on [returning](/document/covid-when-to-return), [testing](/document/covid-test) and [supervisor responsibilities.](/document/covid-supervisors-infographic) March 4, 2021: [Temporary approval to use accrued sick leave for child care reasons due to COVID-19](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/04/temporary-approval-use-accrued-sick-leave-child-care-reasons-due-covid-19) Update for employees on use of sick leave for child care reasons due to COVID-19. March 3, 2021: [All UCR Employees Eligible for vaccine](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/03/all-ucr-employees-now-eligible-covid-19-vaccine) All UCR employees may now obtain a COVID-19 vaccine under state guidelines making those in the education sector eligible. Find out more about how and where to get vaccinated. March 2, 2021: [Fall 2021 Instruction Plan](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/03/02/fall-2021-instruction-plan) Update on Fall 2021 Instruction Plan February 19, 2021: [COVID-19 vaccine update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/02/19/covid-19-vaccine-update) Update on COVID-19 vaccine available at UCR Health. February 1, 2021: [Updated COVID-19 prevention training](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/02/02/updated-covid-19-prevention-training) Campus wide announcement of the updated COVID-19 prevention training. January 26, 2021: [Access to COVID-19 vaccines on campus](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/01/26/access-covid-19-vaccines-campus) Update to access to COVID-19 vaccines on campus January 26, 2021: [Interim Policy Revision - Travel Risk Reduction](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/01/26/interim-policy-revision-travel-risk-reduction) Update on interim policy on Travel risk Reduction (900-25) January 19, 2021: [COVID-19 vaccine update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/01/19/covid-19-vaccine-update) Chancellor Wilcox provides update on COVID-19 vaccine January 14, 2021: [State Budget Update](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2021/01/14/campus-budget-update) Chancellor Wilcox gives an update on the Governor's proposed state budget. November 30, 2020: [Campus update on winter quarter instruction](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2020/11/30/campus-update-winter-quarter-instruction) Campus update on winter quarter instruction including continuation of remote learning, updated schedule of classes and requests for winter quarter instructors. October 26, 2020: [Required Worksite Specific Plan Centralized Process Launched](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2020/10/26/required-work-site-specific-plan-centralized-process-launched) Centralized process announced for Worksite Specific Plans submissions prior to returning to campus or continuing working. October 23, 2020: [UCR Announces Continuation of Modified Operations Through Winter Quarter](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2020/10/23/ucr-announces-continuation-modified-operations-through-winter-quarter) UCR will continue the same modified operations for winter quarter. September 2, 2020: [COVID-19 Testing on Campus](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2020/09/25/covid-19-testing-campus) Summary of groups on campus who are required to undergo COVID-19 testing through our on-campus lab. September 16, 2020: [Safety plans in place for Student Housing](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/stories/2020/09/23/reduced-numbers-regular-testing-planned-fall-student-housing?utm_source=Inside+UCR+Weekly+Test&utm_campaign=84d1a3ca37-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2020_09_23_04_32&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_e039f36024-84d1a3ca37-92866107) Reduced numbers, regular coronavirus testing, and smaller groups are key parts of the plan for fall student housing. SHS is offering flu shots with an appointment. September 4, 2020: [Update on Fall Quarter Campus Plans](https://insideucr.ucr.edu/announcements/2020/09/04/update-fall-quarter-campus-plans) Chancellor Wilcox shares an update to the campus fall quarter instructional guidelines.
